definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: The Chengdu Plain in April, blue skies, such as washing, the Green-Tao singing field.
sentences.chinese: 四月的成都平原，晴空萬里如洗，田野綠濤歡歌。

sentences.english: Normaly, the skies are clear during the north east monsoon.
sentences.chinese: 通常，再東北季風控制下晴空萬里。

sentences.english: The sky was clear, and moonlight was shimmering on the lake.
sentences.chinese: 晴空萬里，湖上月光波光粼粼。

sentences.english: The day came blue and full of sunshine, with little wafts of wind .
sentences.chinese: 那天，晴空萬里，微風在明媚的陽光下輕輕吹拂。

sentences.english: White clouds float on the bed-head in a sunny day.
sentences.chinese: 晴空萬里的白雲飄浮牀頭。

sentences.english: Fall in london has a clear and sweet-smelling sky.
sentences.chinese: 秋日的倫敦晴空萬里，萬籟透香。

sentences.english: Blue skies are generally of love will soon disappear.
sentences.chinese: 晴空萬里的愛情一般都是很快就會消失。

sentences.english: But when he'd looked up the sky was cloudless.
sentences.chinese: 但是擡頭看，天上晴空萬里。

definition: (idiom) sunlight shines over all things/drenched in sunlight
a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
as far as the eye can see (idiom)
Miyun town and county in Beijing
